programme.title: Jimmy's Australian Food Adventure
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty explores the wild foods of Australia in an action-packed journey as he cooks and camps in true outback style

programme.title: A Taste of South Africa
programme.desc: Experience the food adventure of a lifetime with Matt Tebbutt, as he discovers the country?s delicious diversity making meals with farmers, chefs, cooks and an assortment of other enthusiastic eaters.

programme.title: Junk Gypsies
programme.desc: Hop on board the pink Suburban with sisters Amie Sikes and Jolie Sikes- Smith, hosts Junk Gypsies, as they dust off dressers and re-imagine relics at the flea market.

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Presenters Kate Humble and Ben Fogle go behind the scenes of Longleat Estate and Safari Park, in Wiltshire, England - which has over 9,000 acres, a 450 year old stately home and 400 wild animals.

programme.title: Love Nature: Catching The Impossible
programme.desc: Catching the Impossible follows a host of like-minded fishing enthusiasts on their travels through Britain to catch the biggest fish, as the impossible becomes reality.

programme.title: Heritage Rescue
programme.desc: Rangitoto Island's museum is a snapshot of bach life in the mid-1900's, however it desperately needs displays which are more accessible to visitors, especially foreign tourists.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil is beside the seaside this week while Kirstie is covering the countryside as they take on the Norfolk property market searching for homes for 2 sets of house hunters.

programme.title: Buying & Selling with the Property Brothers
programme.desc: David and Siobhan are desperate to find a new family home, but in the city's red-hot real estate market they keep getting outbid. The couple is now determined to create a bidding war of their own.

programme.title: The French Collection
programme.desc: With 800 Euro to spend, contestants compete to make the most profit by buying vintage items and collectables in the brocante markets of France, upcycling them then selling them on in the UK.

programme.title: Cash Cowboys
programme.desc: Join the Cash Cowboys for an incredible coast-to-coast adventure as they rummage through barns to basements in search of hidden treasure they can make a profit on.

programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty explores the wild foods of Australia in an action-packed journey as he cooks and camps in true outback style

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 Bradshaw's Guide, Michael Portillo embarks on a new series of railway journeys across Europe following the suggested itineraries.

programme.title: Money For Nothing
programme.desc: The upcyclers tackle an old road light, a seventies-style sofa and a set of moth-eaten blankets. Will they manage to turn trash into cash?

programme.title: Love Nature: John James Audubon: Drawn from Nature
programme.desc: John James Audubon, who became synonymous with American conservation, killed thousands of birds during his quest to create his famous catalogue "Birds in America".

programme.title: Food Safari Earth
programme.desc: Vegetables have a sexy side! Food Safari returns with a brand-new series that explores the endless possibilities of fruits, vegetables, herbs, spices and more.

programme.title: Cheese Slices
programme.desc: Cheese Slices takes a delicious look at the world's best-loved cheeses and explores the passion and the skill of the cheese makers who create them.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys are in Iowa - their home turf. For his own entertainment, prankster Frank has a few practical jokes up his sleeve. The boys stumble across a bundle of vintage toys and a very unusual item.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus believes rarity equals riches and finds a quirky Volvo that Will's hardly heard of - the 480 ES. There?s only one issue -it's owned by a dealer who, despite loving the car, couldn't start it.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: Follow the men and women that make up the crews and lifeguards of Britain's RNLI (Royal National Lifeboat Institution), an army of unpaid volunteers who risk their lives to save the lives of others.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: After a week on Vancouver Island, several of the participants are finding success in their new environment. But while some work in harmony with the wilderness, others battle against it.

programme.title: Gourmet Farmer
programme.desc: A food critic arrives to write a review of Fat Pig Kitchen, and Matthew Evans goes full circle - from critic, to criticised.

programme.title: Valentine Warner's Wild Table
programme.desc: Valentine Warner is in Saskatchewan to taste three sisters soup. He also visits a lobster truck in New Brunswick to create a thermador.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Along America's back roads, treasures are waiting to be found - valuable relics hidden in junk piles, barns and garages. Mike and Frank find these lost artefacts and hopefully turn rust to riches.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Tim's neighbours find a python wedged half way down a drain at their home. Tim has to call in reinforcements to remove the snake, meanwhile Chris treats an abandoned kitten.

programme.title: Where The Wild Men Are with Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Julia and Gareth bought a cheap derelict house online, without ever visiting Eastern Europe. Ben gets stuck into life in the couple?s run-down farmhouse, installing a window and cooking by campfire.

programme.title: Sarah Off the Grid
programme.desc: Sarah juggles the duties of general contractor, designer and mum as she tries to integrate her daughters' ideas into the design of their bedrooms, even if she doesn't always agree.
